item.title: Expresses a strength of the correlation between a categorical variable and a objective variable with the correlation ratio
item.description: Pearson’s Product-Moment Correlation coefficient, calculated from the covariance \(\mathrm{Cov}(x,y) = E[(x - \bar{x})(y - \bar{y})]\) and the standard deviation \(\sigma_x = \sqrt{E[(x-\bar{x})^2]}\), is usually used for expressing the correlation. $$ \rho_{xy} = \frac{\mathrm{Cov}(x,y)}{\sigma_x \sigma_y} $$ However, since this coefficient expresses linear correlation between quantitative variables, it cannot be used for categorical variables, which are qualitative variables.
